title: Episode 30 - "Late Show"
guest_stars: Janeane Garofolo, Dave Grohl, Flip Orley, John Popper

transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed
WAITING

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: From the Ghost Planet, try our famous pecan log! It's Space Ghost, Coast to Coast! Tonight, Janeane Garofolo, hypnotist Flip Orley, Foo Fighter Dave Grohl, and John Popper. (camera zooms in on building and flies through the window, breaking the glass, then it flies down the hall toward the studio) Plus Zorak and the Original Way Outs. And now, the ghost who put the word "host" in Space Ghost, (with echo, as in original cartoon show) Spaaaaace Ghooooost! (audience applause)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hello, and welcome to the big show, kids. I'm your host Space Ghost, but please feel free to call me... Space. (Zorak plays the organ)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You are one nutty fabulous cuckoo, hi-yo... (cough) Well, you know.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And now I'd like to harvest a bumper crop of belly laughs with some hilarious opening joke statements. So, uh, I'm coming to work, and my friction detector sense a strange force invading my personal perimeter. Turns out it was just a lonely fat guy rubbing up against me. (rim shot) Ha, heh, hee hee! Oh, man. (Zorak plays the keys) Got that, Zorak? "Friction detector."

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Friction detector!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Jerry, Jerry, can we get a close-up of that guy over there? Hey, hey, Zorak! Get a load of that guy. Yow! (closeup of ugly mantis)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yes!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You is one ugly space dude! (Ugly mantis looks sad, then a tear trickles down his cheek)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh, that's cold!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Now, I have a special message for any intelligent life forms that may be receiving this television signal trillions of light-years away, in the farthest reaches of the universe. (pause) (Italian accent) Hey, how ya doin', kids?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (plays the keys)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, get me a close-up of the hem of my cape.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Is it me, or this cape hanging low? Is it me? I mean, I'm practically dusting the linoleum.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Dusting the linoleum, sir!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Can I get some scissors out here? Scissors?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Scissors? Hi-yo!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Scissors, please? Scissors? Scissors! Scissors, please!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (in control room) He knows they won't let him have scissors.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Now, ladies and gentlemen, do me a favor and put your hands together and say hello to Zorak. Or, or as we say in Indiana, Zoo-rake.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (plays the keys)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: They're like a bunch of stunned carp out there. Uh, Zorak, you have a special surprise for us?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yes I do, pinhead!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Go on with your bad self!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Pinhead!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Again!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Pinhead, pinhead, pinhead!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Who has more fun on their little cartoon show than us?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I hate you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, ladies and gentlemen. Zorak!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Okay! Tonight, sitting in with the band, from Blues Traveller, it's John Popper!

transcript.speaker: John Popper
transcript.dialogue: (plays blues harp and sings)Here's a little story,About a certain talk show host,He goes by the moniker, that's French,of monsieur Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) That mouth harp is catchy, John! How d'ya operate it?

transcript.speaker: John Popper
transcript.dialogue: It's a lot like life, you have to blow, and you have to suck.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh boy...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Something harmonica boy said; there could be a joke in there. If only I could reformulate it, and throw it back to him. Hmmmm...)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: It's officially a lull.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (I know!) Where's my pineapple?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (plays the keys)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Italian accent) Hey, kids, how's it goin'?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (plays the keys)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh, now it's time for a quiz. Zorak, do you have a little quiz music?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Uh uh. I'm shedding my exoskeleton.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I told you to shed before the show.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ahhhh! It's so itchy!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (motions toward destructo ray button, aiming at Zorak)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (starts playing quiz music)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Question number one - This man is:A: The Lone locust of the ApocalypseB: The Last of the Red Hot MamasC: An Aphid munching Geranium JockeyAnd the answer is... (John plays the harmonica) the answer is... and the answer is...

transcript.speaker: John Popper
transcript.dialogue: (moves hands as if playing drums) Bom bom bom bom...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And the answer is...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (plays the keys)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: ... not circled on my card. Let's move on, shall we?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (plays more quiz music)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Savvy New Yorkers recognize this man as:A: A city worker on a breakB: A boat show visitorC: John Popper's less successful brother, Pudgy Popper

transcript.speaker: John Popper
transcript.dialogue: Oh, it's that kind of show!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Oh, great! Cue the singing frog, camera one.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: All righty! Time for tonight's Big Ten List. (applause)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Here we go, kids. Number ten: (drum roll) Larry King's left suspender. Number four: Hydroponic Culkins. Number seventeen: Everywhere you look - Dizzy Whip. Y'know, I don't think there's a man, woman or child (drum roll stops) on the face of the earth today that doesn't enjoy a steamin' cold mug full o' Dizzy Whip.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Dizzy Whip, sir!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Number six: (drum roll) Gillooly's butt. Number three sixty-one: A derby full of Nyquil. And number one: (tympani roll) Two words.

transcript.speaker: (Final screen contents
transcript.dialogue: )SPACE GHOSTBIG TEN LIST1. TWO WORDS361. A DERBY FULL OF NYQUIL6. GILLOOLY'S BUTT17. EVERYWHERE YOU LOOK -- DIZZY WHIP4. HYDROPONIC CULKINS10. LARRY KING'S LEFT SUSPENDER

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sniff) Uh, that's it. We have any music here?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (plays Mexican hat dance excerpt)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It's getting like a Mexican game show in here.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (growls) ¡Te detesto! (also as subtitle)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey kids, do you like the rock and roll? Then say hello to Erma Bombeck.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (plays the keys)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (talking to someone off-camera) Wha... Are you sure? (to camera) Oh dear. Well then, please welcome Janeane Garofolo.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (plays the keys)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're Janeane Garofolo. Quick, who am I?

transcript.speaker: Janeane Garofolo
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Are you sure you're not Uma or Oprah?

transcript.speaker: Janeane Garofolo
transcript.dialogue: (laughs, then coughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: ("Killing me Softly" in background) Uma... Oprah... Oprah... Uma...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (singing) Killing me softly with his jokes...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What about Kukla or Kinko?

transcript.speaker: Janeane Garofolo
transcript.dialogue: Zorak wants us to (motions with her hand and whispers) wrap it up.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak can lick my center of gravity.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Not even with Moltar's tongue.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (in control room) Technically speaking, it's an oblong titanium slat.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Anyways, getting back to...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: What are your secret powers?

transcript.speaker: Janeane Garofolo
transcript.dialogue: I have the amaaazing ability to forget people's, uh, names, after meeting them even a number of times.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Quick, who am I?

transcript.speaker: Janeane Garofolo
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Wrong. My name is Luca, I live on the second floor.

transcript.speaker: Janeane Garofolo
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (She is one happenin' lady.) Janeane, you are one happenin' lady.

transcript.speaker: Janeane Garofolo
transcript.dialogue: Thank you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Describe your ideal man.

transcript.speaker: Janeane Garofolo
transcript.dialogue: Deep resonant voice.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Booming?

transcript.speaker: Janeane Garofolo
transcript.dialogue: Booming voice.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Beefy?

transcript.speaker: Janeane Garofolo
transcript.dialogue: Beefy burly voice.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Big chunks o' beef and noodles, like a stroganoff?

transcript.speaker: Janeane Garofolo
transcript.dialogue: Don't forget the cheese.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yes, cheese! Delicious cheese!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Feta cheese.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Fuzzy cheese.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Quease cheese.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (plays the keys)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Cheese. It's what's for dinner. (Italian accent) Hey, how ya doin', kids?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (plays the keys)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: If you could date anyone, and I mean anyone, who would it be?

transcript.speaker: Janeane Garofolo
transcript.dialogue: Ummm... Catwoman and Pat Buchanan.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Janeane, this is a family show. Please keep your hippy-time freak-out love jams to yourself.

transcript.speaker: Janeane Garofolo
transcript.dialogue: (shrugs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (clears his throat) Let's answer our viewer mail. (intro music) This is an actual response to actual letters from actual viewers. (looks at letter) No, No, No, No, Maybe, No, Uh uh, Good Lord no!, No, and Maybe. Quick, Janeane, do some comedy.

transcript.speaker: Janeane Garofolo
transcript.dialogue: (tries to lean on her elbow but misses) Whoop!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Whoop, there it is! But seriously, Janeane, tell us the truth about cats and dogs.

transcript.speaker: Janeane Garofolo
transcript.dialogue: Can't, that gives it away.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Tell us!

transcript.speaker: Janeane Garofolo
transcript.dialogue: I'm sorry, you gotta be cleared for that.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I must know the truth!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You want the truth?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I demand the truth.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You can't handle the truth!

transcript.speaker: Janeane Garofolo
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stares back, then looks at Zorak and clears his throat)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I had a part in the movie, and I, uh, brought a clip.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, I had no idea! Go ahead and roll it, Jerry. Yeah, this should be solid gold.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I will devour each and every one of you, that is the truth! Do you know the muffin man? (evil laugh)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Don't quit your day job, mantis! So Janeane, word on the street is you have tattoos.

transcript.speaker: Janeane Garofolo
transcript.dialogue: How did you know about that?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Does that make you cool?

transcript.speaker: Janeane Garofolo
transcript.dialogue: I think I am, but ask me again in about five minutes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I would, but my guess is, ya won't be around.

transcript.speaker: Janeane Garofolo
transcript.dialogue: I have to go to the bathroom.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Let me show you the way.

transcript.speaker: Janeane Garofolo
transcript.dialogue: Thank you, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (blasts her off the monitor with his destructo ray)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Oh boy, I'll be hearing from her people.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I knew this wasn't gonna work.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Welcome back, vast North American viewing audience. Now it's time for something we like to call, "Stupid Zorak Tricks". Whadd'ya have cooked up for us tonight, Zorak?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I have covered my keyboard with a mucus-y membrane. (shot of keyboard covered in green goo)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Aaand...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: And, that's it. Just the mucus-y membrane.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Right, right. That's not much of a trick, do you have anything else?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I could vibrate.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh huh.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (vibrates back and forth, with sound effects)

transcript.speaker: John Popper
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, okay.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sucks in breath, puts his head in his hand) Yep, that's money in the bank.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Leno has Hugh Grant, and we've got a vibrating insect.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's enough, Zorak. You're making us all sick.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I'm a little logey myself.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, take a little standing nap. (to audience) For weeks now, my mother has been reporting to us from the desolate surface of the ice planet Zeron. (Mom Ghost appears on monitor, shivering, with ice planet in background) Hi, Mom!

transcript.speaker: Mom Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hi, sweetie.

transcript.speaker: John Popper
transcript.dialogue: Mom!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: She's my mom, not yours!

transcript.speaker: John Popper
transcript.dialogue: (makes growling sound)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So tell me, Mom, how's everything going on that remote hunk of frozen rock?

transcript.speaker: Mom Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (shivering) Fine, honey.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, how ya holdin' up in the poisonous ammonia atmosphere?

transcript.speaker: Mom Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sighs) Just okay. (shivering) All the radiation makes me tired, and my vital organs are givin' me fits.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And we all know how painful that can be.

transcript.speaker: Mom Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I may be askin' for one of your space kidneys soon.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Hang in there, Mom!

transcript.speaker: Mom Ghost
transcript.dialogue: When can I come home? I'm cold. (shivers)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Not until sweeps is over. So long, Mom!

transcript.speaker: Mom Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Bye bye, sugar.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) That was Mom, Zorak! Oh, she's something, isn't she?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yes!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: There she goes, kids, that's my mom! (she fades from monitor) (applause) Let's keep it goin' for her. (applause continues) Everybody loves the visits with my mom. And, and I'll tell you straight out, they leave me, jazzed.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You feelin' jazzed right now?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Jazzed, to the max! Zorak, do you feel jazzed?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I'm jazzed, baby! Jazz, jazz, jazz-a, jazz, jazz, hi-yo!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (pause) (aside) Wha? Now what? Are you sure we have time for this? You're positive? (to audience, with less enthusiasm) Hokay. Put your hands together, ladies and gentlemen, for big time Hollywood hypnotist Flip Orley.

transcript.speaker: Flip Orley
transcript.dialogue: (on monitor) Hey, thanks for having me, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (under his breath) Thank Tony Randall for cancelling. (aloud) So, that's some jacket you got there, Flip. Looks like something the mantis would wear.

transcript.speaker: Flip Orley
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, and I've got the, the little dingle balls on the, on the jacket, which, obviously, if you look at the dingle balls, very closely, you can actually fall under my power... (keeps talking)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Dingle balls, yes!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Stay... interested...)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I can hear you.

transcript.speaker: Flip Orley
transcript.dialogue: Have you ever been drunk, Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Nope, but I've been jazzed. But right now I'm not jazzed. Nope, not very jazzed.

transcript.speaker: Flip Orley
transcript.dialogue: Even now, even as we speak?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (pause) I'm sorry, what?

transcript.speaker: Flip Orley
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) I guess we'll move on. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (hums to himself) So, uh, how's your summer going?

transcript.speaker: Flip Orley
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost, what kind of a dupe do you take me for? What kind of a moron, wha, what do you think I am?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: What do you think I am?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Did you say something?

transcript.speaker: Flip Orley
transcript.dialogue: Uh, we were starting to do an interview.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Starting the interview process, yes!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, uh, know any good... what is it you do again?

transcript.speaker: Flip Orley
transcript.dialogue: I can actually make people think I'm invisible, through my hypnotic powers.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hypnotic powers.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That would be doing us all a favor.

transcript.speaker: Flip Orley
transcript.dialogue: Wow, that's kind of personal, Space Ghost, isn't it?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yes!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Let's see... (hums to himself) What else? Hey, are you jazzed?

transcript.speaker: Flip Orley
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I, um, I'm jazzed.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yes! I am jazzed!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Excuse me, won't you, Chip?

transcript.speaker: Flip Orley
transcript.dialogue: My name is Flip. Flip Orley, Hypno-man.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sure, yeah. Zorak, do me a solid and hypnotize this dingle ball into something cool.

transcript.speaker: John Popper
transcript.dialogue: Put him to sleep.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (eyes turn into spiral pattern, rotating counterclockwise) We brellah bing cleeya pakka vinsta loopah sahtah 'teebesta noabrella blah!

transcript.speaker: Dave Grohl
transcript.dialogue: Thank you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Speak to me, oh spirit! Are ya a cool guest come to help us? Or, are ya just another big load?

transcript.speaker: Dave Grohl
transcript.dialogue: (chewing gum) My name is David Grohl, I play in a band called the Foo Fighters.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Bingo! Pay dirt! Atta boy, bonanza! Now we're cookin' with gas! I am now once again certifiable jazzed, kids!

transcript.speaker: Dave Grohl
transcript.dialogue: You're a lucky man.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And, you're a punk, aren't ya?

transcript.speaker: Dave Grohl
transcript.dialogue: I'm a punk.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I knew it. I'm a little bit frightened of you, and I like the feeling. It's all tingly. (Italian accent) Hey, how ya doin', kids?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (plays the keys)

transcript.speaker: Dave Grohl
transcript.dialogue: It's wonderful.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, what's the deal with Foo?

transcript.speaker: Dave Grohl
transcript.dialogue: Foo's good.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, you're pro-Foo, and not anti-Foo?

transcript.speaker: Dave Grohl
transcript.dialogue: We do, not actually fight Foo. We are, the Foo Fighters.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) God bless ya, Dave. Now Dave, do you like me?

transcript.speaker: Dave Grohl
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) I suppose.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hear that, Zorak? Dave thinks I'm cute. What do you think of the show, big D?

transcript.speaker: Dave Grohl
transcript.dialogue: Your show is so great! I just can't even tell you, it's really wonderful! I'd, I'd, my mother watches it, every, every, uh, every night that it's on, whenever it is.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: My mom would watch too, but the ice planet's septic atmosphere has infected her eyes badly, so she can't...

transcript.speaker: Dave Grohl
transcript.dialogue: I, can't even imagine what your mother would look like.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: She looks like me, with red lipstick.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You've been known to wear red lipstick after one too many wine coolers.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's it. (blasts Zorak with his destructo ray)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oww! (Popper's monitor goes flying through the explosion) (coughs) You can explain to Charivari what happened to their vest. (coughs) Hi-yo!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Dave, you are currently touring the galaxy. What other shows have you appeared on?

transcript.speaker: Dave Grohl
transcript.dialogue: I think that we've performed on the David Letterman show before.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Whovid Whatterman? Never heard of him.

transcript.speaker: Dave Grohl
transcript.dialogue: Like, he can't hold a candle to you, Space Ghost, no way.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ho, I can hold candles. It's the scissors they won't let me touch. They're afraid I'll hurt my foot again. Y'see, I got this giant blister. Like a door knob!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ewww!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (makes gagging noises, walks away from his console)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And I'm cutting away the dead skin, right? Like a big giant fleshy pancake. Flip, flop, flip, flop, I couldn't walk for seven months! I still wear a smaller bootie on that foot.

transcript.speaker: Dave Grohl
transcript.dialogue: Mucus is a problem in space, what with the decompression, and comp-, y'know.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Boy, you're tellin' me! Man, at the end of the day, my suit is filled with it! Come around five, when I take off that suit, it's like a Jell-O mold, squeezin' out. Hey Zorak, you ever get the suit mucus?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Suit mucus, yes sir!

transcript.speaker: John Popper
transcript.dialogue: Does he look all mucus-y?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Like an Irish oyster.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, Dave, thanks for coming!

transcript.speaker: Dave Grohl
transcript.dialogue: (looks around) What?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Thanks for joining us.

transcript.speaker: Dave Grohl
transcript.dialogue: (looks around, puzzled)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's it. (blasts Dave off of monitor with destructo ray) (applause) Dave Grohl, ladies and gentlemen, there he goes. Now, strap yourselves in, boys and girls, it's time for a special treat. Where's Morty?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: We had to amputate that infected limb.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I mean Moltar, where's Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (on Space Ghost's monitor, with outdoors backdrop; he clears his throat)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Thanks for joining us, Moltar.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (background music) Y'know, folks, from time to time, we like to send our director Moltar into the universe with a hidden camera and earpiece through which I give commands. It's a real hoot! We call it "Fun with Moltar" (superimposed screen title "Fun with Moltar") Here's Moltar at Burger Town, ladies and gentlemen, watch your monitors, and kids, you at home, as usual, use your televisions. Okay, Moltar, say "I'd like some french fries."

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (standing in front of speakerphone at drive-in) I'd like some french fries?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: "And a strawberry shake."

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: And a strawberry shake.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Say "That's all," then pay him, then eat the food.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: What's so funny about this?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Just do it. Then, we sent Moltar to see the fire serpent.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Say "Hello, my name is Jimmy."

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh, I, I don't know about this.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: "Hello, my name is Jimmy."

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hello, my name is Jimmy.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Now say "Do you want to see me do the jazz box?"

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: What, are you kiddin', he'll murder me!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Do the jazz box, Moltar.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You get out here and dance!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Do the jazz box, Moltar.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: But...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Jazz box, jazz box, jazz box! Start dancin', metal head!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Eh! Here goes... (sings and dances) Ink, a dinka dink, a dinka dink, a dinka do...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Aaagh!!! Aaaaagh!!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Well, that's all the time we have for tonight, kids. (Popper starts playing his harmonica in background) I'd like to thank my guests, Janeane Garofolo, Flip Orley, Dave Grohl, and Popper. (Popper keeps playing his harmonica) Popper, stop that infernal noise! (he keeps playing) Popper! Popper! (he blasts Popper with his destructo ray)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: So, uh, what did you think of the show tonight?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That show blew like the solar wind. We had better run the standby.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Cheez, the standby? It's a pretty old one.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Who's on that one?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Flip Orley. He hypnotizes Teri Garr.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh please!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I'm jazzed, baby!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's it, prepare my escape pod. I'm going to ABC.
